[color=#a4885c]Ship Size:[/color] Large
[color=#a4885c]Recommended Crew:[/color] 3-8
[color=#a4885c]Power Gen Type:[/color] AME

"A full-size expedition shuttle for dedicated mercenaries and military surplus enjoyers, the KAZ-refitted Yegorov-class light cruiser is an old navy workhorse. A piece of surplus from when the USSP was still a major polity, the newly-refitted hulls are starting to see sales in the Frontier sector."
# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the substation units are anchored to the floor. - Check that the SMES units are anchored to the floor. - Check that the shuttle's APC units have their breakers toggled On.
## 1.2. AME generator unit
- Check that the AME control unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the AME control unit has a fuel jar inserted. - Ensure the injector count is set to twice that of the core count. Any higher and the AME risks exploding. - Start the AME control unit.
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Check that the oxygen and nitrogen canisters are anchored to their respective connector ports. - Check that the mixer unit is set to 101kPa. - Check that the gas mixer is set to the correct mixing ratio (21% Oxygen, 79% Nitrogen). - Enable the mixer unit.
## 2.2. Waste Loop
- Ensure that the waste loop pipes are all properly installed. - Ensure the waste loop pump is powered and enabled. It is located on the port thrusterbank access catwalk directly fore of the dock.
## 3. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled.
## Important Notes
- Ensure the shutter control switch in the bridge is functional. It has a yellow frame and will activate a strobe light that indicates the state of the shutters. - The red-framed switches in the atmos chamber and hangar bay toggle depressurization of the hangar bay. The depressurization system will set off a warning strobe light when active. Please do not engage the switch without wearing proper safety gear. The white-framed switch in the atmos chamber will toggle the repressurization pumps if necessary. - The yellow-framed switches near the hangar bay doors and the torpedo tube access in the fore section of the ship are for toggling the blast doors.
